intro: Mastichodendron fimbriatum, commonly known as the fringe-leaved mastichodendron, is a rare and unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its distinctive, fimbriated (fringed) leaves that give it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Burseraceae and is known for its aromatic resin, which has been used traditionally in various ways. It thrives in the arid and rocky environments of Socotra, adapting to the extreme conditions of the region. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
